title: Julia Roberts makes a nod to her polka dot dress from Pretty Woman at Veuve Clicquot's Polo Classic
text:
Julia Roberts respects her cinema roots, and it shows.

The Hollywood film star visited the 10th Annual Veuve Clicquot Polo Classic at Will Rogers State Historic Park in Pacific Palisades, California on Saturday, in an outfit that would make any film fan immediately think of one of her most defining roles.

Roberts, 51, wore an adorable black-and-white polka dot jumpsuit with charming pleated detailing, similar to a famous polka-dotted ensemble she wore almost 30 years ago.

Pretty woman in polka dots: Julia Roberts visited the Veuve Clicquot Polo Classic on Saturday, in an outfit that would make any film fan immediately think of one of her most defining roles

In her 1990 film Pretty Woman, Roberts wore a glorious chocolate brown dress to the Los Angeles polo match her character Vivian is taken to by Richard Gere's Edward.

That dress featured white polka dots as well, just like her jumpsuit on Saturday.

The similarities didn't stop there, as both outfits were belted at the waist — in the current version, Julia chose a thin white belt in lieu of the thicker brown one she wore in the film.

Like her character's ensemble, Roberts also completed her new look with white footwear, in the form of dress shoes with black laces.

A wink and a smile: In her 1990 film Pretty Woman, Roberts wore glorious chocolate brown to a Los Angeles polo match, in a dress that featured white polka dots as well

The only thing missing is the hat: The similarities between the looks are undeniable

The only element missing from the Pretty Woman costume, in fact, was the large-brimmed sunhat with matching ribbon.

A few other contemporary updates to Julia's 2019 look were a pretty pair of rounded, gold-framed sunglasses, as well as a dark or even black manicure — perhaps in preparation for a Halloween costume later this month.

Pretty Woman is the film Roberts can credit for making her a bona fide Hollywood superstar — before that, she was a critical darling with acclaimed supporting turns in films like Mystic Pizza and Steel Magnolias, the latter even scoring her her first Oscar nomination.

What about the Arsenio cheer? Julia was seen watching the horses in the polo match, reminiscent of when she was a spectator of same in the film and cheered raucously

But it was with the lead role in Pretty Woman — a role initially offered to brat-packer Molly Ringwald, which she turned down — that gave Julia her leading lady status, as well as a second Oscar nod.

After eventually going on to score an Academy Award for her leading role in 2000's Erin Brockovich, Roberts has gone on to appear in many other roles, most recently gaining positive reviews for her portrayal of a social worker involved in undercover dealings with the military in the Amazon Prime series Homecoming.

Up next, the Sleeping With The Enemy star will headline the dramatic thriller Little Bee, based on the novel by Chris Cleave.
